content.text: Modules
App
This is the react display for the module manager.
to do:
get the status
set the state message - NOTE: implemented for es. need to implement for npm. Need better error handling.
load the loaded or installed or latest version (now I load the _earliest_) -
add the commands links (and commands) - NOTE: Added the commands for es modules (review them though)
make it prettier
I have a version compare function - it is not correct. It is a temporary simple implementation
Module Element
This element is the display element for a module from the repository.
Body Element
This is the body of a module display element. It is shown when the module element is in the expanded state.
Internal Elements
This element displays the loaded/installed status of the module from the app
This element is used to show or hide the module body.
These are the demo workspaces for a given module versoin.
This is a link for a demo workspace for a given module version.
This is a link to go to the web space for the module.
This is the dropdown to select the active version for the given module.
These are the commands for load/unload and install/uninstall for the module.
Command Generation
This function determines the commands that should be sent given the selected version of the given module.

{url}

content.text: KLUDGE - Remote Module Manager
We need a way to run some external (to model) code on startup. We mock this up by creating a custom component and create a global object just once.
In the global object we put the
sendMessage
function and add a
receiveMessag
e function which we use as a message listener.

In onLoad, we define some functions to pass data into the model, which we use to handle some messages sent from the remote app. (Alternatively, we could have loaded functions from the model that did this for us. Here we would do that by loading them from data. Externally, we would load them from the workspace/model.
Here is where we pass data to init the modules and to set the app status.
Repository Data
This is the requested data from the repositories
TESTING DATA

fields.html:
This is a dummy component to do some global stuff

  • get the calling window and other init info
  • On load, create functions to pass message data into the model
  • create a globals function to send messages
  • start the message listener loop

Here I am doing a kludge to add CSS, by putting in a custom component just to add CSS.
